newsitem.title: USA: Computational sees Q2 EPS below views.
newsitem.headline: Computational sees Q2 EPS below views.

text.p: Computational Systems Inc said Monday that while it expects second quarter sales to exceed those of last year, its sales and earnings will not meet analysts' consensus estimates for the quarter.
The company said it expects the second quarter to be "slightly" profitable.
According to First Call, the mean consensus estimate for the second quarter is $0.24 a share. The company reported a profit of $0.19 a share on $11.2 million in sales in last year's second quarter.
The company said that second quarter sales and earnings will be hurt by the level of sales in the first two months of the quarter and current levels of bookings for the remainder of the quarter.
Sales have also been hurt by weaker than anticipated business levels in the international arena and the domestic activities of its M&D and MachineView units.
Computational said that to reduce costs, it will cut its staff by about 10 percent and take other steps to reduce general and administrative expense.
The company said it is also refocusing its marketing efforts both internationally and domestically.
